ETYMOLOGY: From Old French prosperer, from Latin prosperāre ('cause to succeed, thrive'), based on the adjective prosper ('favorable, fortunate').

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To succeed in material terms; be financially successful or thrive.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 成功；兴旺；昌盛（尤指经济上或事业上的发展）
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Small businesses tend to prosper when the economy is stable.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 当经济稳定时，小型企业往往会兴旺发展。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Of a person or organization) To be fortunate or well-off.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 幸运；境况良好；生活美满
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We hope all people who live here will continue to prosper in peace.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们希望所有住在这里的人都能在和平中继续安居乐业。

REGISTER: General use, often employed in contexts relating to finance, business, and well-wishing.
